page.title: 05SHEEP REARING
page.content: All the farms in this area keep sheep.They are kept mainly for the lambs as the farmers do not get high prices for the wool from the local breeds.Sheep are probably the animal best-adapted to the damp rough pastures around here. Lambing takes place in April to avoid the cold damp weather of earlier in the year.The sheep are also dosed and injected against disease as well as the legally required dipping.Breeds kept include Cheviots,Swaledales, Black-Faces, Leicesters and various cross-breeds.
